episodes.name: "10 minutes a day" A salute to Club Med
episodes.description:
On this podcast I dive back into meditation which has been a big part of my life for the past 3 years. I went back to meditating silently for 10 minutes a day then speaking what came up into my practice. I hope you enjoy my first podcast back in a while. The content isn't the most in depth but we do what we can. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Produced by: JD Ferrell	
Presented by the Modern Podcast Network and themodern.fm

episodes.name: Dissecting 'Between the World and Me' and the Conceptualization of Ta-Nehisi Coates
episodes.description:
In this podcast, I dissect the major themes of the acclaimed autobiographical story about Ta-Nehisi Coates. The story is a beautiful written depiction of the Black experience told to Ta-Nehisi's son. Then I conceptualize Ta-Nehisi through a feminist theoretical orientation. Come on this journey with me. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Produced by: JD Ferrell	
Presented by the Modern Podcast Network and themodern.fm

episodes.name: Catching up w/ Arial Messerli
episodes.description:
It has been a couple weeks since Arial and I have caught up on her acting in a pandemic. She just comes on the podcast to catch up and see where we are both currently at in life. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Guests: Arial Messerli
Produced by: JD Ferrell	
Presented by the Modern Podcast Network and themodern.fm

episodes.name: Moving to China w/ Hasina Sadiwala
episodes.description:
Hasina Sadiwala decided to move to China after she got her undergrad to become an english as a second language teacher. It wasn't and still isn't the easiest thing to do, but it is by far the best decision she has ever made in her life!
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Hasina Sadiwala
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: SAG Cards, and Getting Casted in a Feature Film w/ Arial Messerli
episodes.description:
Arial Messerli got casted in her first feature film!!! She comes on the podcast to talk about that role, doing a table read, and what it takes to get your union card as an actor.
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Arial Messerli
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: New iPhones, iPads and Apple Watches w/ Stephen Meriwether
episodes.description:
Apple Products! Apple is releasing new IPhones, iPads, and Apple watches and Stephen Meriwether joins the Podcast to talk about them all!
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Stephen Meriwether
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: Healthcare, Medical School, and Alphabet Soup w/ Malayna Hocker
episodes.description:
We all know about the debilitating debt that students go through when choosing to become a Doctor, but do you really know? Malayna Hocker joins us for her segment "Alphabet Soup" to talk about her journey through medical school. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Malayna Hocker
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: Acting in a Pandemic w/ Arial Messerli
episodes.description:
Arial Messerli Joins A Modern Man podcast to discuss beginning her acting career in the middle of the pandemic. She lives in Los Angeles and has finally quit her Day job to pursue acting full time. She talks about her first paying gig to possibly booking her first lead in a feature film. 
Guest: Arial Messerli 
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: Spiking Her Way to College Dominance w/ Hayley Daniel
episodes.description:
Hayley Daniel Joins A Modern Man Podcast to talk about her recruitment to college volleyball. She shares her incredible journey of transferring to 3 different colleges to pursue her love of college volleyball!
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Hayley Daniel IG: @hayreneeeedan Snapchat: @hayley3renee
Producer: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network

episodes.name: Apple's Weapon to Combat Child Pornography w/ Stephen Meriwether
episodes.description:
Stephen Meriwether joins JD Ferrell to talk about how Apple has decided to combat CSAM. Also JD Ferrell just moved to Chicago, Illinois to start graduate school. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Guest: Stephen Meriwether
Produced: JD Ferrell
Presented by The Modern Podcast Network and TheModern.fm

episodes.name: 20 years in Afghanistan and Delta Rising
episodes.description:
The result of all the troops being removed from Afghanistan  and the impact of the unvaccinated and Delta Variant. 
Speaker: JD Ferrell	
Producer: JD Ferrell


Themodern.fm

episodes.name: The Daily life of an OnlyFans Content Creator w/ Sonia Contreras
episodes.description:
Sonia Contreras joins the Podcast to talk about her experience since joining Onlyfans. She shares why she is comfortable sharing her body and why it’s a sign of empowerment and self expression. 
Producer: JD Ferrell
Guest: Sonia Contreras

episodes.name: Amazon Origin Stories and the Billionaire Space Race
episodes.description: Stephen Meriwether Joins me to talk about the history of Amazon and the significance of Jeff Bezos stepping down as the CEO of Amazon. He also talks about the Billionaire Space Race and I introduce a new segment called Win!

episodes.name: Why I am taking a week off
episodes.description:
My name is JD Ferrell. I am the host of A Modern Man Podcast and Co-founder of the Modern Podcast Network. 
I didn’t want to take a week off without telling you why I felt it was necessary for me to take a week off.

episodes.name: 16 years and Still Fighting w/ Christina Moralez
episodes.description:
Christina Moralez Talks about the `16 years her and her Husband Brandon have been fighting through Renal Failure. What they go through on a daily basis and unknown statistics about organ donors. 
Host: JD Ferrell
Guests: Christina Moralez
Producer: JD Ferrell
Listen to all our podcast https://themodern.fm/

episodes.name: Malindi Evan's New Single and Window's 11 w/ Stephen Meriwether
episodes.description: New Artist Malindi Evans Joins me to talk about her new single Out my Mind which debuted June 25th. She talks about her rise and passion for music. Stephen Meriwether joins me for another segment of "The Modern Tech Talk" to tell me about the new features for Windows 11.

episodes.name: My Journey To Being a Modern Man
episodes.description: JD Ferrell explains his journey to becoming a modern man. He talks about his journey through foster care, adoption, and going through college.

episodes.name: What the Average Consumer Needs to Know about Crypto w/ Brenden Easter
episodes.description: Brenden Easter Joins the Podcast to talk about what the average consumer should know and should be doing in the cryptocurrency market. He talks about day trading, and what how we are in DeFi Summer 2.0 right now!

episodes.name: The Apple WWDC w/ Stephen Meriwether
episodes.description: Stephen Meriwether joins the podcast to talk about the Apple WWDC and some big changes coming with IOS 15. There is no major changes coming this year but still plenty of things to be excited about.

episodes.name: Live From the 23rd Floor
episodes.description: JD Ferrell is live from the 23rd floor on Aire Rooftop bar in Chicago, Illinois. He talks about his future and why he is in Chicago and also the Future of the Modern Podcast Network.

episodes.name: Alyssa Ashenfarb on Mental Health and What is Cryptocurrency with Brenden Easter?
episodes.description: Alyssa Ashenfarb talks about Mental Health Awareness Month and what a lot of us are going through. Brenden Easter educates us on what is Cryptocurrency.

episodes.name: The Voices of Motherhood
episodes.description: As Mother's Day passed I asked a few Women to revisit the time before they became a mom. Were they nervous? I asked them about the things they have experienced that you can't plan. Then I ask them to define motherhood.

episodes.name: Teacher Appreciation Week and What is Infrastructure?
episodes.description: In this episode, I share my appreciation for the Teachers and Educators in my life who affect me every day and I share in the memories I have of them. I then discuss what I consider to be infrastructure for a country.

episodes.name: Trauma and Ruptured Relationships with Alyssa Ashenfarb
episodes.description: In this Episode of A Modern Man Podcast, I Interview Alyssa Ashenfarb. She has a Master’s in Social Work and is a counselor at a private practice out of NYC. She talks about working with clients with issues with trauma and ruptured relationships and how most people don’t understand how closely related the two things are.

episodes.name: New Gun Laws, DACA and Voter Suppression with Breeana Danell and Emily Pham
episodes.description: In this episode, Breeana Danell is the guest host of the podcast. She brings on her best friend of almost 15 years on the podcast to talk about Biden's new gun laws with some new human rights laws with a path to citizenship. We also talk about how republicans are afraid of the people actually voting because Democrats have the numbers and so their only solution is to make it harder for the citizens to vote, so they will lose interest in the system.

episodes.name: Run. One Step at a Time and Survey Segment
episodes.description: In this podcast, I read my article Run! One Step at a Time. It talks about my journey and where I found my love of running. I also launch the survey segment as a part of the podcast. It is where I take a survey and dissect the responses.

episodes.name: Why Can't We Just Have a Conversation with Ryan Taylor and Breeana Danell
episodes.description: In this episode, I interview Ryan Taylor. He identifies as Republican, but we share a lot of the same ideals on policy issues. This is the conversation that Bree and I have.

episodes.name: Soulmates come in Many Shapes and Sizes with Breeana Danell
episodes.description:
I was thinking about Soulmates and how they come in many different forms throughout our lifetime. I discuss these different forms with Bree as we also talk about some of the best and worst soulmates we have had in our short lifetimes.

episodes.name: The Journey of Becoming with Alyssa Lynn and Grammy Recap with Bree
episodes.description:
On this episode of A Modern Man, I welcome Bree to The Modern Network as she does the 2021 Grammy recap with me. She joins me to talk about some of our best and worst moments of the award show. Then I sit down with my friend Alyssa Lynn to talk about her Journey of Becoming. 
Follow Alyssa on IG
@flowingfromwithin
Follow Bree

episodes.name: Getting into Grad School and life lesson from Warren Buffet
episodes.description:
In this episode, I talk about my journey of applying to graduate school and the rejection you should expect if you are pursuing higher education. I also talk about the struggles of being a young adult trying to figure out what to do with your life. I used a technique that my friend taught me. He learned it from Warren Buffet and hopefully, it can help you out as well. 
Please Like and Subscribe if that's your thing

episodes.name: 2021 Golden Globe Recap
episodes.description:
This is a recap of the first big award show of 2021. They did put together a great product even though it was virtual. 
The film Mank lead the show with 7 nominations, but ultimately The Crown won the most awards with 4. Some of my favorite winners were Borat Subsequent Film, Queen's Gambit, and Daniel Kaluuya for Best Actor in Judas in the Black Messiah.

episodes.name: Should Stimulus Checks become the Norm?
episodes.description: In this episode of A Modern Man Podcast, we discuss the idea of stimulus checks becoming a regular occurrence when there is a widespread need for them. I want to apologize now for my voice or the lack of one. I am sorry, it should be back by next week.

episodes.name: Why I hate V-Day and Britney Bi***th
episodes.description: In this episode of A Modern Man, I talk about my disdain for Valentine’s Day. How I feel it takes all the romance and spontaneity out of the day. I also give my thoughts on Britney. The superstar is now seen as a Martyr.

episodes.name: Cancel Culture, The N-Word, and Morgan Wallen
episodes.description: We discuss my feelings on cancel culture and where it all begins. Then we talk about the N-word and its origin. Also, the countless celebrities who have all said the N-word and have come back to prominent fame. Then I give my feelings on Morgan Wallen and if I believe he should be canceled for his actions.

episodes.name: From the Village, To Girl Dad, Through Covid with Scott DeRosa
episodes.description:
On this episode of A Modern Man Podcast, I am joined by my friend Scott Derosa. Scott and I met playing volleyball this fall. He talks about his struggles growing up with a father of addiction in the panhandle of West Texas. He did not come from a diverse community, but the village that raised him taught him to love his neighbor regardless of who they are and what they look like. He then left the small town with big-city dreams just outside of Houston. He spent a few years there until he met his eventual wife. This led him to be a girl dad to 3 incredible young girls at such a young age. He made the commitment and moved to Oklahoma City in 2008, and he has been here ever since. After a decade of marriage, covid came. He thought he was changing careers and inevitably leaving Oklahoma, but the pandemic changed that. He was lucky enough to stay at his job for a few months longer than expected, but after that, he was unsure of his future. All he knows for sure is that he wants to be honest and respectful of everyone’s struggle and he understands we all need help sometimes. 
Add me to get a shoutout!

episodes.name: Practicing Medicine in a Pandemic with Dr. Peter B. Stanbro
episodes.description:
On this episode of A Modern Man podcast I sit down with Dr. Peter B. Stanbro to discuss his experience throughout the Pandemic. He talks about the thousands of patients that would have been without medical care if he wasn’t proactive with his thinking about his practice. Many specialties were suffering during the pandemic, but he managed to increase his staff and patient count. He discussed some of the barriers between insurance companies and giving patients quality treatment. He finishes the podcast talking about some of the legal changes that are allowing mid-level providers such as PA’s and Nurse Practitioners to be able to branch out and create their own practices in some states therefore minimizing a doctors credentials.

episodes.name: Dating Through A Pandemic with Arial Messerli
Bartending in NYC Through a Pandemic with Kristen Leger
Teaching During a Pandemic with Jordyn Irvin
episodes.description: In this podcast, I sit down with my friend Jordyn who is currently a 2nd grade teacher in Enid, Oklahoma. She talks about some of the biggest challenges teachers are facing during a global pandemic. She also talks about some of the crazy protocols that she goes through, so hopefully you will learn and empathize with teachers as we are nearing the end of the pandemic.
